My general tip on coding agents is that their goodness is inversely proportional to number of tips you need.

If you are busy setting up skills, plugins, memory, .md, hooks - you are actually trying to put band-aids on your broken coding agent.

user.name: Fran√ßois Chollet
user.description: Co-founder @ndea. Co-founder @arcprize. Creator of Keras and ARC-AGI. Author of 'Deep Learning with Python'.

user.description: TTRPGs, Warhammer, geeky things. Views are my own, take it or leave it. Non-political but leaning conservative

fullText:
Questions for TCG players:

1) Do you expect game stores to buy or trade TCG items as well as sell them? If not, would you go elsewhere (to a store that did both)?

2) If they do buy or trade, do you expect them to handle low-value "junk" cards or only higher-value ones?
